article:
The following is a list of rhododendron cultivars and species which have gained
the Royal Horticultural Society's Award of Garden Merit. They are mostly hardy
evergreen shrubs with abundant, brilliantly-coloured, trumpet-shaped flowers,
often in large spherical trusses. The group known as azaleas are often (but not
always) more compact with smaller flowers and leaves, and may be evergreen
(subgenus [[Rhododendron subg. Tsutsuji|Tsutsuji]]) or deciduous (subgenus
[[Rhododendron subg. Pentanthera|Pentanthera]]). Most rhododendrons bloom for a
short period in late spring (April to May in the temperate Northern Hemisphere).
They are seen at their best in a woodland setting with light dappled shade, in
humus-rich acid soil.

Maximum dimensions are shown in metres.
